articles.author: Steve Benen
articles.title: Who's left in the White House to limit Trump when he's 'spun up'?
articles.description: John Kelly said he'd intervene when Trump would get "spun up" and bark irresponsible orders. Who has that job now?
articles.content: In September 2018, the New York Times published a striking anonymous op-ed written by a senior official in the Trump administration, which characterized Donald Trump as an ignorant and erratic leader, unfit for leadership, whose decisions needed to be contain… [+2723 chars]

articles.title: New book looks at Trump's relationship to 'The Fixers'
articles.description: Investigative reporters Joe Palazzolo and Michael Rothfeld discuss their new book 'The Fixers,' which looks at Trump surrogates who pay hush money to cover up his affairs, and detailing Trump's relationship with his fixers.

articles.description: Today's installment of campaign-related news items from across the country.
articles.content:
Today’s installment of campaign-related news items from across the country.

articles.title: GOP strategist pens book on how to save America from Trump
articles.description: Republican political strategist Rick Wilson joins Morning Joe to discuss his new book 'Running Against the Devil,' the current state of the GOP and why he says if Trump wins in 2020, then get ready for Don Jr. as president.

articles.author: Steve Benen
articles.title: At the intersection of Trump's health care lie and his ACA case
articles.description: Trump wants to be seen as "the person who saved Pre-Existing Conditions in your Healthcare." That's ridiculously false for a variety of reasons.
articles.content: For proponents of the Affordable Care Act, the last couple of months have been quite encouraging, at least as far as the substance of health care is concerned. Totals from the recent open-enrollment period, for example, were solid and in line with expectation… [+4241 chars]

articles.title: Cory Booker drops out of 2020 presidential race
articles.description: Sen. Cory Booker announced Monday that he is ending his campaign for president. The New Jersey senator, one of two African Americans remaining in the race, struggled to break into the top tier of candidates and raise campaign funds, announcing in September th…

articles.title: Chief Justice to be ‘master of ceremonies’ more than judge at Senate impeachment trial

articles.description: NBC News' Richard Engel gives an inside look at what's left of the Ain al-Asad air bases in Iraq after it was targeted in an Iranian missile strike.

articles.title: White House appears to abandon calls for a full impeachment trial
articles.description: Seven weeks ago, Team Trump wanted "a full trial," of "some length," featuring a "factual affirmative defense on the merits." Now, it wants the opposite.
